importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, when Brandy issued her official statement clarifying the incident during the Chicago concert of the joint tour with Monica.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred during a weekend concert stop in Chicago, specifically during the performance of The Boy Is Mine Tour, which began weeks prior and was preceded by weeks of rehearsals.

keyTakeAways: Brandy abruptly left the stage during a joint concert with Monica in Chicago, leaving Monica to complete the performance solo.
Brandy later explained that she experienced dehydration and a feeling of fainting, and that she prioritized her health over continuing the show.
The decision to exit mid-performance created public confusion and disappointment, especially since the tour is named after their 1998 duet, 'The Boy Is Mine,' which was not performed.
Brandy expressed gratitude to Monica for stepping up professionally and to the tour crew for their support, and stated she went to a doctor after the incident.

The tour, which had been eagerly anticipated, was rumored to have underlying tensions between Brandy and Monica, though Brandy emphasized their shared history and emotional connection through the song.
Brandy described the impact of 'The Boy Is Mine' as a powerful moment of unity between two women, which resonated globally and continues to do so.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Brandy has clarified that she left the stage mid-performance during a Chicago concert of her joint tour with Monica due to experiencing dehydration and a feeling of fainting, prioritizing her health over continuing the show. Despite her efforts to return, she was unable to fully connect sonically with the performance due to physical and technical adjustments. Monica graciously completed the show solo, and Brandy expressed gratitude for her professionalism and the support of the crew. The incident sparked public confusion and disappointment, especially since the tour is named after their 1998 duet, 'The Boy Is Mine,' which was not performed. Brandy emphasized that the song remains a powerful symbol of unity between two women and continues to resonate globally.
title: Brandy explains why she left Monica all alone on stage
